episodes.original_body:
Case: Forrest-Muss-MVA-07-20-2025
Client: Forrest Muss

Forrest, It's Justin. This is a text only number for your file. Anything you send here will save directly to your file. Please send me your DOB, SSN so I can send a formal request for records to the Little Clinic. Also, if possible send all those photos here as well.
episodes.natural_language:
Case Forrest-Muss-MVA-07-20-2025. Client: Forrest Muss.

Initial client contact on July 20, 2025, regarding a motor vehicle accident. The communication came from Justin, who wrote to Forrest Muss: "Forrest, It's Justin. This is a text only number for your file. Anything you send here will save directly to your file." 

Justin stated that he would use this text-only number for the file and asked Forrest to provide his date of birth and Social Security number so he could send a formal request for records to the Little Clinic. He wrote, "Please send me your DOB, SSN so I can send a formal request for records to the Little Clinic." He also requested that, if possible, Forrest send all of the photos related to the case to this channel: "Also, if possible send all those photos here as well."
episodes.author: Justin Chumbley

episodes.original_body:
Case: Forrest-Muss-MVA-07-20-2025
Client: Forrest Muss

Completed comprehensive 5-phase file organization for case. Reorganized 18 files from root directory into 8-bucket system: 4 files to Client folder (fee agreement + intake verification with PDF+MD companions), 14 files to Investigation folder (7 burn injury photos + 7 evidence photos including McDonald's grill slip, Little Clinic receipt, illegible visit note, and 3 additional evidence photos), 5 files to Medical Records/Little Clinic (PA Tejah Strickland visit note, payment receipt, and medical billing request template). Deleted 2 empty text files. All files renamed following YYYY-MM-DD naming convention with proper categorization. Created subfolder structure for Little Clinic medical records (Medical Records, Medical Bills, Medical Requests). Quality review completed with 11.1% error rate (2 corrections applied). Verification confirmed 100% compliance with naming conventions and companion .md files. Case folder now fully organized and ready for active case management. Reports generated: file inventory, reorganization map, quality review summary, and final verification report saved to Reports folder.
episodes.natural_language:
In the Forrest-Muss-MVA-07-20-2025 case file for client Forrest Muss, I completed a comprehensive five-phase file organization. I reorganized 18 files from the root directory into an eight-bucket system: four files were moved to the Client folder (fee agreement and intake verification with PDF and Markdown companion files), and fourteen files were moved to the Investigation folder (seven burn injury photos and seven evidence photos, including a McDonald’s grill slip, a Little Clinic receipt, an illegible visit note, and three additional evidence photos).

Additionally, five files were placed in Medical Records/Little Clinic (including the PA Tejah Strickland visit note, a payment receipt, and a medical billing request template). I deleted two empty text files, and all remaining files were renamed according to the YYYY-MM-DD naming convention with proper categorization. I also created a subfolder structure for Little Clinic medical records, including Medical Records, Medical Bills, and Medical Requests.

A quality review was completed, revealing an 11.1% error rate with two corrections applied. Verification confirmed 100% compliance with naming conventions and companion Markdown (.md) files. The case folder is now fully organized and ready for active case management. Reports were generated, including a file inventory, a reorganization map, a quality review summary, and a final verification report, all saved to the Reports folder.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)
